ygData.subject: Women are never happy with one thing. (no offence)
ygData.msgSnippet: ** Dinobot simply watched with a blank expression as Tavatron turned her back on him, watching her shoulders slump and her ears hang. In any other case he

Subject: Women are never happy with one thing. (no offence)

From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

** Dinobot simply watched with a blank expression as Tavatron turned her 
back on him, watching her shoulders slump and her ears hang.
In any other case he wouldn�t even be here, as cold as he was. And he still 
hadn�t lost the touch.
Dinobot simply stood there with his head turned towards Tavatron, his 
expressions blank and the same as any other time that he simply expected 
something which he knew that he was going to get�whether they like it or 
not.
It wasn�t difficult to see hat there was a lot bothering Tavatron, and in a 
sense he wished that he could have just kept his mouth shut and woken up 
with a blank mind. But he hadn�t, and he had offended her with words he knew 
that he meant but not in the way that she had received them.
All he head meant to do was express that he was disappointed in her and that 
running away from problems never solved anything. They would always be there 
until one simply stopped and dealt with them. You could never just leave 
them behind. And for those who had managed to do that, those problems were 
always there when they came back.
And they always came back.

Dinobot shifted his weight from one clawed foot to the other, feeling his 
muscles whine and grind. Still recovering from being immobile for so long. 
Reminding him of what had happened before he had gone into stasis lock, a 
growl trickling from his throat.
He had tried for as long as he could to keep himself from slipping into it 
before, and all he could figure was as soon as he began to relax, seeing the 
CR room only a little distance away, he had let down his guard and went into 
stasis.
Later waking up heaving on tubes which had been jammed down his throat!
Now Dinobot kept it in mind not to be so careless again, letting his wounds 
get that bad again. He swallowed.
He could still feel the rawness of his throat after he ripped those tubes 
out!
Looking down at Tavatron as she crossed her arms and sat at the edge of the 
cliff, he turned his mind back inwards and towards what really mattered. 
Just why he was there and what he was waiting for.
But Dinobot had watched Tavatrons ears perk up at his apology, just hoping 
that she wouldn�t rub it in and ask just why he had done it.
He had his own reasons, and making sure that he didn�t lose the first real 
friend he had.
Fellow warriors were one thing, but good friends were another�or so he had 
hoped.
Dinobot almost found himself cringing as Tavatron opened her mouth to speak, 
expecting some other hard thing that he would have to do just in order to 
keep one step in front of this femm. Though, relaxing as he heard what she 
really was going to say, finding it that he really didn�t have a reaction to 
her words other then turning his gaze back over the edge of the cliff with 
the same old blank look.
But he still thought that he was getting soft.
Dinobot�s head snapped towards Tavatron again as she flopped down onto her 
back, simply slowing his breath until it stopped as the cloud of dust rose 
up from the impact. Resuming his breath intake as the dust cleared away.
He was still recovering; dust in his lungs was one of the last things he 
needed.


Dinobot only looked down at Tavatron for a moment before looking back over 
the fast expanse of tree tops which was laid out before him below the cliff, 
his tail moving in smooth motions, back and forth behind him.
He had to admit something even though this atmosphere was mainly dead quiet, 
as well as unsteady. This was a rather nice spot. Wondering slightly if 
Tavatron came here often to escape the worries and cares of life.
But soon, even the carefree ease of the reason he was there drifted into old 
habits. Finding himself surveying the area for any unusual movements of tell 
tail signs that there were bots about.
Two bots along was no patch for a group of highly trained Alliance or 
Predacon factions�if they had such members. Besides, he was still recovering 
and even HE knew that now he wouldn�t even be able to stand up to Tavatron, 
waiting for his components to settle back into the new settings of his 
repaired body.
Dinobot rolled his shoulders a bit, finding that they were a bit sore but 
much more smooth in their motion then when he had first moved out to follow 
Tavatron�when he had to concentrate on each step�basically.
His attention was then caught as Tavatron began to speak again, looking down 
at her in surprise and a little annoyance as she finished asking her 
question.
As if apologizing wasn�t hard enough!

Dinobot growled, his first response to Tavatron question before the same 
cawing which had drawn her attention had also drawn his. Almost seeing 
something burning, almost like a commit but too big to be a stasis pod, but 
it was lost in the flurry of feathers, and by the times the birds had 
thinned it was gone.
There were times he cursed the seeming nature of this planet, with it�s 
storms when he was cold, it�s excessive heat when his systems were nearly 
melting from overheating, and it�s wildlife when he was trying to see!
But he then turned his attention back towards Tavatron, looking down for a 
moment before lowering his head so that by the time he brought it to a hult 
it was less then 2 inches away from her own snout. Simply looking straight 
down at her, letting out a breath and thinking quickly.**

� If it is the truth you are seeking, with which no doubt I am sure you are, 
then you may have it as well.�

** Dinobot then lifted his head a bit so that there was a fair distance 
between snouts, his sides aching with fatigue from the amount of energy it 
had taken him to get to the cliff�and Tavatron.
Giving him a moment to calculate the truth and see just what he was going to 
say. Because, while through his lifetime, he had learned that woman will not 
just accept one answer, it has to be educated and very well presented.
And through his life�he had had to learn that the hard way!
Also, honesty may not give a woman what answer she wishes, but at least a 
man cannot get bitched at for a fib as well as what he had done to get 
himself into the position where the woman is questioning him.
However, in this case, Dinobot was not the one in question and had done 
nothing wrong. In fact, the roles had reversed and it was the female who was 
feeling the weight instead.
And there was still his answer to give.

Dinobot moved his front claws so that both hands were on each side of 
Tavatron�s head, taking most of his weight off of his legs and easing the 
ache.
His eyes still directed at her, his voice a bit of a growl.**

� My friends have a tendency to die after a certain amount of time. And the 
reason I followed you was not only to know why you left when the position of 
guardian was passed on to you, but also to make sure that you remained safe 
and quite alive.�

** Dinobot then looked at Tavatron harder, his expression solidifying to one 
of complete non-emotion.**

� You are my friend, Tavatron. And one I intend to keep.�

** There, there was his answer. It may seem mushy or so on, but it was the 
truth.
But then Dinobot lifted up his torso so that he was standing at full height, 
his weight on his legs again but still looking down at Tavatron..**

� But the request to return to base has come through, and to comply might be 
wise.�
